messages.message: Hi all, I’m unable to use docker on my local machine. Every docker command, even commands that should just fail instantly for invalid syntax, hang forever on the command line. I have tried uninstalling and reinstalling v4.16.2 and the issue is still happening. Has anyone experienced this or have any ideas?

1. have you restarted your computer?
2. after quitting docker desktop, if you search for `docker` processes in Activity Monitor, do you see anything? if so, kill those processes
I did 2 but did not restart. I’ll give that a shot

Now I get `Cannot connect to the Docker daemon at unix:///Users/adamlipson/.colima/default/docker.sock. Is the docker daemon running?` even though docker desktop is open which I guess is a slight improvement? I’ll keep trying to debug

Can you try this command
`colima start --cpu 4 --memory 16 --arch x86_64`
Your docker is set up thru colima so you need to make sure colima is up

Hmm is it possible that the docker daemon can run somewhere besides docker desktop? When I start IB services I don’t see them in the docker desktop UI but I do see them in `docker ps` and they keep running even after I quit docker desktop
Before reinstalling I uninstalled docker desktop and the `docker` command couldn’t be found on my system so I don’t think I had another binary sitting around somewhere
do you have a default context docker running besides colima?

you could check using
``` docker context ls```
Yup was about to post here that I needed to use default rather than colima. Need to rebuild services to confirm that that fixed it
